page.title: 01GAZETTEER FOR NEWTON STEWART
page.content: Newton Stewart is a small town of about 3,200 people.It is situated in the Wigtown District of Dumfries and Galloway Region in south west Scotland.The town is on the A75 Euroroute some 25 miles east of the ferry port of Stranraer and 51 miles west of Dumfries. This is a bustling town,being the main centre for the surrounding rural area.As a result it contains a surprisingly large range of services including many hotels,banks,shops,a cottage hospital and a secondary school.It is also a market town,holding important livestock sales in spring and autumn,and many services required by farmers are located here,including the auction mart,vet and agricultural engineers.The town is also a popular centre for tourists visiting the Galloway area.
